originalText.text:
As other reviews have mentioned, building started off rough with lack of management and definitely made errors in folks deposits. They brought in a new building manager, and it has made a world of difference. Heâ€™s easier to reach, communicative, and has made any questions you have for the building much more feasible.

In terms of facilities, good amount of space, canâ€™t beat the location (right next to the Apollo), and the door men are all friendly and attentive to any needs or questions you have.

They get a 4 only because I have had issues with cold water a few times, and for the cost of any building in NYC rent wise, should never happen for these prices ðŸ˜‚

Updated: Sadly spoke too soon. There was an elevator outage for 10 days in a row and we live on the 22Fâ€¦.

originalText.text:
Don't move in!
First of all, there is no management in this building. Since I moved in, I contacted the office every month about the First bill payment, and they ignored my emails. I contacted them again on Jan 18th cause I still needed to receive my first bill, and I could not register the account online and make the payment; they told me they lost my contract and told me to send them a copy. Then they rudely came to my apartment on Jan 27th and forced me to send them four months' rent check in 3 days, or they would evict proceedings. They were arrogant and did not acknowledge their management mistake at all.

Secondly, there was a fire in this building two days before Christmas. All the residents were waiting outside at 3 am in -10 degree weather and had no arrangements. After the fire, the building was full of smoke and ash, the pipes broke, and there was no hot water; the elevator was not working; we have many residents living on the 24th floor, which caused us very much inconvenience. They did not compensate the residents in any way.

In short, their service and price could be more matched. You can find a better house for the same price. Don't ever move in; you will regret it for sure!

originalText.text:
Do not move here. The building has no management whatsoever. There is no lines of communication, they rushed to get people in, and the building is honestly not a safe or good place to be as a result of it. Stay away.

In one week we've had a fire at the connected building that the building owner claims didn't affect us, despite lingering smoke and ash, and then a pipe breaking and causing flooding on Christmas day. It was only solved because I noticed it on my way out and reported it.

Both elevators are now down. Tenants are expected to use the stairs, no matter what floor they are on.

Do not move here.

originalText.text:
Please do not move here! It seems as if developers and owners rushed to finish and occupy the building. Management also isnâ€™t any help and will ignore your complaints.

After numerous leaks (one lasted over 2 months), a 1 day+ elevator outage causing me to walk 18 flights of stairs, a fire and the misplacement of multiple rent checks, Iâ€™m now dealing with not having heat in my apartment during this extremely cold weather. Even though the rent here is $2600+, living conditions are subpar, unsafe even. After complaining about not having heat, I was given a portable heater which doesnâ€™t actually heat my apartment.

Iâ€™ve lived here for less than 7 months and in this time frame Iâ€™ve had the office lose two rent checks, I had a leak that was left unfixed for over 2 months, a dishwasher that never worked properly (my request for it to be fixed has been ignored), a leak in my closet which ruined my clothes, and a 24+ hour elevator outage which forced me to walk 18 flights of stairs with my luggage. On top of this, management acts as if tenants shouldnâ€™t ask for rent concessions when they experience negligence like this.
